A picture tells a thousand words - check the attachment!

Maybe someone is working on an unrelated bug and its had this side effect?

fields.description:
Generated from case [CRC-498|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-498].

Is it possible to cluster Crucbile& Fisheye to achieve high availability
fields.summary: Cluster Crucbile& Fisheye to achieve high availability

fields.description:
Add into FishEyeTestEnv.in a BASEPORT param, that defaults to 6000 in the build.xml, but could be overridden with {{ant -Dtest.base.port=7000}}

Find all the places in the code that refer to a port number, and base them off the base.

Eg, currently FishEye opens up at 6060, but it should be BASEPORT + 60.

Simarily, the SMTP listener should be BASEPORT + 25
fields.summary: all fisheye tests that use a port should use a configurable base-range

fields.description:
Generated from [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-495]. 

When a user clicks on Email Review he can send review comments to others that don't get tracked in the system. Thus to help guide people to use Crucible properly some customers would like to disable this button. 

 There is a workaround:

{quote}
In order to do this however you need to download the version of crucible with the jsp source downloads. You can download it from [http://www.atlassian.com/software/crucible/CrucibleSourceDownloads.jspa]. 

To use the crucible + jsp sources you can follow similar instructions as the upgrade instructions:

1) Shutdown your server completely. 
2) Make a backup of your {{FISHEYE_INST}} directory 
3) Follow the instructions in the [Upgrade Guide|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/Z4HdBQ] to start using the crucible + jsp source installation. 

Next, edit your {{CRUCIBLE_HOME/content/WEB-INF/tags/reveiw/StateActions.tag}} and remove the following

{code}
<c:if test="${crev:showEmailReview(review)}">
  <button name="allCommentsEmail"
          type="button"
          onclick="command('allcommentsemail','${review.permaId}', this)">
      Email Review
  </button>
</c:if>
{code}

When you start your crucible + jsp source files, the email button should no longer appear. 

{quote}

However it would be good if we can either add a configuration option within administration for that or add a tool tip "Email a summary of the review comments" to make the purpose of the button clearer.
fields.summary: Allow users to remove the "Email Review" button via the GUI or add tool tip it to make its use clearer.

fields.description:
from Mel Carasso:

Requirements:
1. Replace current message (or add if there isn't one) with the text
*"Your evaluation license for <Product Name> has expired. Here's
the **information you need*
<http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/expiredevaluation.jsp>* to
continue using <Product Name>."*
2. The "information you need" link needs to go to this recently updated
page on WAC:
h*ttp://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/expiredevaluation.jsp
<http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/expiredevaluation.jsp>*

See http://extranet.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=1682606792
for background info.

fields.description:
The overriding method is not invoked anymore when parsing "param" element of an appender.
Currently the getaround is to define all subsitutions explicitly as Java system properties, i.e. fisheye.inst and fisheye.home must be defined in JVM arguments.
fields.summary: SubstitutingDOMConfigurator broken after upgrade to log4j-1.2.15

fields.description:
FE 1.6.* tells customers when new versions are available. The link to get the download is : [http://downloads.atlassian.com/software/fisheye/FishEyeDownloadCenter.jspa] but this is currently a 404.

The link should be [http://www.atlassian.com/software/fisheye/FishEyeDownloadCenter.jspa]. 

This does not affect crucible downloads which point to the correct location.

Customers would like to be able to integrate with SiteMinder for user authentication 

Generated from FSH-1455

The ability to add colour highlighting for custom languages exists but is undocumented. Please add a guide showing how to add a new syntax highlighter to both FishEye and Crucible standalone.

It will also be useful to document the list of languages supported out-of-the-box, and ideally a place where people who create custom highlighters can share them for others to use. These requests can be broken up if needed.
It would be useful to be able to create foreign-language translations of the FishEye's interface so that it can be localised for non-English speakers.
fields.summary: Ability to translate interface into multiple languages

fields.description: Some users run FishEye on repositories containing languages other than Java and would like to be able to define a custom colour/color highlighting scheme to make code more readable.
fields.summary: Add custom syntax highlighting for other languages and conventions

fields.description: When doing a diff in Fisheye, there is a know issue where the Log keyword for cvs repositories isn't parsed properly.  I'm also seeing off behavior when running normal command line cvs annotate on the same file.  Is there any interplay between fisheye and other cvs tools?  Does Fisheye modify any log files that are used by normal cvs command line tools?
fields.summary: Doing a diff in on a file in cvs repository leaves out log entry - would effect other cvs tools?
